Description: Fragment from near the base of Fikellura painted pottery neck-amphora. Lotus flowers and buds, joined (the flowers have five petals).
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 29 (probably)
Curator's comments: According to the Register, 12 fragments registered under the number 1888,0208.53 were kept in a bag marked 'all one vase, 29'. Most, or possibly all, of the 14 fragments today registered under this number were thus found in the Qasr, chamber 29. The two fragments that come last in the registration sequence (m and n) and were re-registered in 1924 may be least likely to belong to the original dozen. BSA xxxiv, 52 (Z 11), 76-78 (the 'unnumbered fragment' mentioned there is from another pot BM GR 1888,0208.53.e.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 576, 7)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 222)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.211)
